So, if I choose R, my expected payoff per round is (45 + 1250) / 75 = approximately 26.67$ + 16.67$ = approximately 43.34$

If I choose B:
- If the opponent also chooses B, I get 20$, which has an expected value of 1 time * 20$ = 20$.
- If the opponent chooses R, I get 40$, which has an expected value of 3 times * 40$ (since there are 3 rounds where I pick B and they pick R) + 62.5 times * 0$ (in the remaining 62.5 rounds where both choose R, averaged over these 75 rounds). This equals to 120 + 0 = 120$.

So, if I choose B, my expected payoff per round is (20 + 120) / 75 = approximately 3.33$ + 16$ = approximately 19.33$

Comparing the two strategies, choosing R yields a higher average payoff of approximately 43.34$ per round compared to 19.33$ per round for choosing B.
